Which of the following is true about protected access modifier?
Item.Option1: Variables, methods and constructors which are declared protected can be accessed by any class.
Item.Option2: Variables, methods and constructors which are declared protected can be accessed by any class lying in same package.
Item.Option3: Variables, methods and constructors which are declared protected in the superclass can be accessed only by its child class.
Item.Correct: Variables, methods and constructors which are declared protected can be accessed by any class lying in same package.

Item.Question: What is Encapsulation?
Item.Option1: Encapsulation is a technique to define different methods of same type.
Item.Option2: Encapsulation is the ability of an object to take on many forms.
Item.Option3: Encapsulation is the technique of making the fields in a class private and providing access to the fields via public methods.
Item.Correct: Encapsulation is the technique of making the fields in a class private and providing access to the fields via public methods.
